message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of delineation of curvilinear structures in microscopy images, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The proposed approach involves the use of supervised machine learning algorithms, which are typically used in computer vision tasks such as object detection and segmentation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also discusses the use of active learning and proofreading techniques to reduce the amount of required supervision. This involves identifying parts of the image that are most critical for accurate delineation, which is a problem that is closely related to machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Finally, the paper focuses on the application of the proposed approach to microscopy images depicting blood vessels and neurons. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia).
